description: Transmission of a message or signal from a source node to a target node.
Receipt of a message or signal by a node from another entity.
An event, condition, or message that initiates a procedure, timer, or state change.
examples: Handover is TRIGGERED_BY signal strength drop

description: A change from one state or operating mode to another.
A hierarchical or structural relationship where one entity is a component of another.
A timer reaches its limit during the execution of a specific procedure or state.
A property or parameter is assigned a specific setting or measurement.
One entity or configuration object sets the parameters for another.
An entity possesses or is associated with one or more configuration sets.
A dependency where one entity or feature needs another to function correctly.
examples: High-speed mode REQUIRES specific carrier frequency

description: The beginning of a procedure, timer, or operational phase.
examples: RACH procedure STARTS when preamble is sent
T301 STARTS upon receipt of RRCReestablishment

description: The termination of a procedure, timer, or operational phase.
examples: T300 STOPS when RRCSetup is received
